intro: Solanum liximitante, commonly known as the wild tobacco plant, is a species of flowering plant in the nightshade family, Solanaceae. It is native to various parts of Africa, particularly in regions with tropical and subtropical climates. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub, reaching heights of up to 1.5 meters, with simple, ovate leaves and showy, tubular flowers that range in color from white to purple. Its fruit is a fleshy, berry-like structure that contains several seeds, and it is often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides. Solanum liximitante is known for its chemical compounds, some of which have been studied for potential medicinal properties.
